attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Prime Minister, please answer to your employers (the citizens of this Country) and not the Washington Hawks.

Mr McKinnon's crime was committed in the UK not the United States.

As such he should be tried in the UK for a UK crime under the UK Justice System.

Are Citizens of the UK subject to the laws of all other Countries or just some?  If some which Country's laws do we have to be aware of? - 

We the Citizens of this Country have a right to know which laws we are governed by.

rejection.details: We can not accept petitions about individual legal cases. In this case, the Home Secretary does not have general discretion. He can only stop extradition if he finds that McKinnon’s human rights would be breached.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
